item.title: Don't Kill Them All is A Lot Like Cult of the Lamb, but with Orcs
item.description:
Orc mindfulness simulator Don’t Kill Them All wears its roguelike inspirations on its sleeve. In particular, Fika's upcoming turn-based strategy indie game takes heavy inspiration from 2022’s Cult of the Lamb .

The bond between the two titles is most evident in Don’t Kill Them All ’s Kickstarter campaign, which Cult of the Lamb developer Massive Monster backed. Getting that support for Don’t Kill Them All from their spiritual sibling was an important goal for Fika, the studio’s co-founder Antoine Grégoire-Slight told Game Rant in a recent interview. Grégoire-Slight spoke on how Cult of the Lamb is woven into Don’t Kill Them All ’s DNA, and why getting to work with the team behind it on a small collaboration for the Kickstarter campaign meant so much.

Cult of the Orc

Speaking specifically about how Cult of the Lamb inspired Don't Kill Them All , Grégoire-Slight explained,

Cult of the Lamb is an inspiration for the game because it's split into two phases. There's the build your own cult aspect and then going on raids and exploring dungeons with the roguelike phase. It was also a loop that we felt really compelled to play and wanted to have a game that can have the thrill of building your own things and going to explore dangerous environments.

This general design heavily informed the core gameplay loop in Don’t Kill Them All . Orcs will spend their mornings engaging in hobbies, passions, and mindfulness exercises before going out on an afternoon raid. At camp, the player can use resources gathered on raids to construct new means of improving the emotional well-being of the orcs, which in turn makes them better, more versatile raiders to join the player’s orc life coach out on the field.

In the afternoon, a small war band will explore procedurally generated environments, gather resources, recruit new orcs, and carry out side quests. Those resources go back to the camp, and the orcs from yesterday’s war band rest and recuperate during the next raid. The moods orcs are in when they head out–ranging from the Inside Out main five of anger, happiness, sadness, disgust, and fear to feelings like confusion and shame–have impacts on the orcs' abilities in combat.

The inspiration taken from Cult of the Lamb is clear in that gameplay loop, but the two games seriously diverge in their execution of that loop. Where Cult of the Lamb is about gaining worshippers, Don’t Kill Them All is about learning that bloodlust isn’t the whole of being an orc. Some orcs are painters, or fishers, or magicians, and there's even a Lamb Orc, in theory at least.

We have created our version of the Lamb that we have posted on social media–we had quite a lot of fun doing that. We have done that as well with other game studios, and we will continue to do that on social media. We’ll decide later on if we put some of those skins in the game or not…We just want to make sure that it fits with the characters and the environment that you are exploring in the game. This is mostly for fun, but we had fun with that collaboration.

Check out the Don’t Kick Them All Kickstarter , ending June 6.

Stretch Goals Are More than Money to Fika

Kickstarters for games have a bit of a checkered reputation. For every hit like Sea of Stars, there are plenty of promising Kickstarter campaigns that get canceled. Already having secured the funding to finish their campaign successfully, Don’t Kill Them All cleared the financial hurdle they sought to vault with Kickstarter’s help, but that’s far from the only purpose a Kickstarter campaign has. Fika figured out a way to maximize the second primary goal of Kickstarters: to generate attention and interest in a game.

Where stretch goals tend to be focused on reaching certain thresholds of money raised after the campaign ends, Don’t Kill Them All includes plenty of stretch goals focused instead on community engagement. Getting backed by Cult of the Lamb ’s team was one of the first goals achieved by the campaign, with other goals including numbers of Steam wishlists, Discord members, followers on social media platforms, and players sharing their passions with the team at Fika.

We encourage them to create fantastic fan arts and also share their passion with us because we are taking a lot of inspiration and creating this game, but we are still two years from the release. I don't know, maybe some of those passions that are shared with us will be inspiration for creating passions in the game for orcs. Those two goals of 100 backers that post art and 100 backers sharing some sort of passion would be really incredible to get.

It remains to be seen how the remaining stretch goals for Don't Kill Them Al l go, but still, as far as Fika’s first Kickstarter goes, Grégoire-Slight is happy with the result. Ship of Fools , the previous title from Fika, wasn’t Kickstarted. Grégoire-Slight explained that the process of developing a Kickstarter was a new challenge for the company, but it was something very educational.

Launching a Kickstarter means developing eye-catching graphics, a presentation video, deciding rewards, finding fulfillment partners, and coming up with potential features to unlock through the innovative use of stretch goals Fika employed. Fika was doing all of this at a relatively early stage of development given the game is targeting a 2026 release.

It was a great, great experience. We learned a lot. Now we are pretty happy that the campaign has been funded, so we can say that we have reached our objective, and now we are trying to extend that campaign as much as possible in terms of reaching different achievements and increasing funding that we can get for the game…It's not too late to pledge and help us in making this project as great as possible.

With backers like the team from Cult of the Lamb giving Fika their support, the campaign only has to stick the landing and start development. No decision has been made about any possible Early Access releases for Don’t Kill Them All , but a backer-exclusive closed beta is on the cards targeting next year.

item.title: Diablo 4: How To Use The Tree Of Whispers
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Use The Tree Of Whispers In Diablo 4
  • How To Complete Grim Favors In Diablo 4

Diablo 4 has a lot of endgame content for players to engage with to continue powering up their character and perfecting their builds to take on the Nightmare Dungeons in Diablo 4 . One of these useful endgame additions is the Tree Of Whispers and completing Grim Favors to earn its rewards.

Players who are making a seasonal character and skipping the main story can get instant access to the Tree Of Whispers and begin earning its rewards right away. The Tree of Whispers is a great source of XP and items and even gives players a choice of what specific rewards they want.

How To Use The Tree Of Whispers In Diablo 4

The Tree of Whispers appears as a red tree icon with a skull at the top on the eastern side of the map . Hovering over the icon will display a progress bar showing players how many Grim Favors they have completed and how many more need to be done to get rewards. After completing ten Grim Favors, players will get a side activity icon over the tree and will need to return there before any more Grim Favors can be earned.

Returning to the tree will give players an option of three reward caches to choose from, with each focusing on different weapon types, armor pieces, or the Collection of Chaos. Selecting a clearly labeled collection will give players multiple high-end gear pieces of that type, along with all sorts of additional rewards, such as XP, Gold, and consumables for upgrading gear . The Collection of Chaos can still offer high-end rewards and offer any kind of item or gear piece at random.

How To Complete Grim Favors In Diablo 4

Grim Favors are earned when completing Whispers , which are small side activities that are maked on the map with red or light red icons. Whispers are always cycling, with new ones spawning randomly throughout the map to replace existing or completed ones. By hovering over the icon of a Whisper, players can see how many Grim Favors are earned by completing the activity.

Grim Favors are also earned by clearing Dungeons in Diablo 4 that are maked with the red icon on the map, usually offering more Grim Favors than any Whisper task. After earning ten Grim Favors, players won't be able to complete any additional Whispers until they return to the Tree Of Whispers. Whispers will still spawn within Helltide events, and offer players a lot more rewards than usual for completing them on top of the rewards from the tree, making any Whisper in a Helltide a great use of time.

item.title: Mortal Kombat: Ed Boon's Recent Jason Voorhees Teases Explained
item.description:
Mortal Kombat 1 has already featured its fair share of high-profile crossovers with the likes of Omni-Man, Peacemaker, and the upcoming inclusion of Homelander. But Mortal Kombat 1 still has plenty of room to add more and the game's creator, Ed Boon, has been teasing a variety of potential new characters that may be part of Mortal Kombat 1 's future plans.

Recently, Ed Boon has been hosting a variety of polls on his official Twitter account that are asking for fan feedback on what characters should come to Mortal Kombat 1 next. That said, Friday the 13th 's Jason Voorhees has stuck out among these teases due to Ed Boon not only featuring him in a poll but also hyping up his inclusion in MultiVersus .

Ed Boon Teasing Jason Voorhees in Mortal Kombat 1

As one of the most iconic faces, or masks, in the horror genre, Jason Voorhees is already part of the Mortal Kombat franchise. His first and only appearance in the long-running fighting series was in Mortal Kombat X as a DLC character, but there is a very real possibility that he or other classic slashers could return.

Ed Boon Asks Fans Which Characters Should Return

On May 14, Boon went to Twitter to ask fans who they thought should return to the Mortal Kombat franchise. The poll offered three options, with each option containing three characters that could possibly be featured in Mortal Kombat 1 :

  • Freddy, Kratos, and Leatherface
  • Alien, Predator, and Jason
  • Terminator, Rambo, and RoboCop

Although all the options offered would be great to see again, Alien, Predator, and Jason were the winners among fans who participated in the poll. With the game's first DLC Kombat Pack nearing completion, it only makes sense that a second one could already be in the works, and based on the feedback of this poll, it could lead Jason back to the brutal world of Mortal Kombat .

At the time of this writing, there is no official confirmation that Jason Voorhees will be coming to Mortal Kombat 1 ; plus, Ed Boon has made similar remarks before and nothing suggests that any posts on social media will lead to anything at all.

Paying Special Attention to Jason Voorhees

Not only has Ed Boon been offering polls for fan feedback, but he's also been really focused on Jason Voorhees in general. It's now been revealed that Jason Voorhees is in MultiVersus , the brawler title based on Warner Bros. properties, and Ed Boon has clearly been quite excited about the inclusion of the character. Once again, on Twitter, he mentioned that those who miss playing as Jason in Mortal Kombat X can at least play as him in MultiVersus .

This could easily just be the enthusiasm of someone who is a huge fan of the character, but the constant attention Boon is giving to Jason could be hinting at something bigger. MultiVersus and Mortal Kombat don't have much in common, especially when it comes to the violence, which will make it interesting to see Jason in a cartoonish setting.

However, with both games being owned by Warner Bros., it isn't too far out of the realm of possibility for Mortal Kombat 1 to bring back Jason, in addition to him being in MultiVersus . Jason was incredibly fun to play in Mortal Kombat X , so hopefully Ed Boon's excitement regarding the character is hinting at something more.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Adorable Hand-Carved Vileplume Figure
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Pokemon fan is showcasing a stunning Vileplume figure they created, sharing a hand-crafted and hand-painted statue of the Grass Pokemon.
  • Pokemon's first generation of creatures continue to be some of the franchise's most popular cast members, regularly featuring in fan creations.
  • Vileplume and its evolutionary line has appeared in nearly every main-series Pokemon game to date, only being absent from 2022's Pokemon Legends: Arceus.

A creative Pokemon fan is showing off their impressive hand-crafted Vileplume figure, showcasing a stunning homage to the classic Kanto Grass Pokemon. With over 1,000 Pokemon to choose from, the long-running monster-catching franchise has featured plenty of fan-favorite designs throughout its nine generations of games and multiple anime series. Fans have often shown off their love for their favorite Pokemon with stunning real-world creations, crafting everything from figures and art to shoes based on Pokemon like Espeon. However, one subset of Pokemon remains among its most popular.

The 151 Pokemon featured in the original games continue to hold plenty of nostalgic value for long-time fans of the series. The first Pokemon games welcomed in some of the series' most iconic designs, like franchise mascot Pikachu, the original three Starter Pokemon, and the powerful Mewtwo. The original games also still serve as Pokemon 's most successful titles to date, with the first generation Game Boy games selling over 40 million copies worldwide. Now, classic Grass Pokemon Vileplume is the subject of a stunning fan creation.

A post shared to the Pokemon subreddit by Reddit user samheck shows off an impressive Vileplume figure created from scratch. The user confirms that the adorable Vileplume figure was hand-carved and hand-painted, with the Grass Pokemon carrying a walking stick against a natural rocky background. The Vileplume features a recessed mouth and small extrusions on the figure for its eyes, giving the figure a 3D appearance similar to how it would look in real life.

Pokemon Fan Creates Hand-Crafted Stunning Vileplume Figure

While the intricacies of the Vileplume figure saw plenty of praise from fans in the replies, the comments were also filled with one fun fact about Vileplume. Vileplume is said to be based on the "Rafflesia Arnoldii," a poisonous type of flower that emits a particularly unpleasant odor. Vileplume's inspiration and foul stenches are even mentioned in the Pokemon's Pokedex entries, said to turn the air around it yellow as it walks due to the paralysis-causing pollen it emits. The creator also shared that the Vileplume was not their first carving of the evolutionary line, previously creating an Oddish figure.

Since Vileplume's debut in Pokemon Red and Blue , the Grass Pokemon and its evolutionary line have been mainstays throughout the Pokemon franchise, appearing in nearly every main-series game. While Vileplume did not appear in the base game for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , the Pokemon was added with the Hidden Treasure of Area Zero's Pokedex expansion. The only main-series game to not feature Vileplume was 2022's Pokemon Legends: Arceus , with the Oddish line not available in the Hisui region. The stunning Vileplume figure is an impressive homage to one of Pokemon 's original creatures.

item.title: Minecraft Releases Another Pre-Release Patch Ahead of Update 1.21 Launch
item.description:
Highlights

  • Minecraft's Tricky Trials update promises exciting new content and challenges for players, including new locations, enemies, and weapons.
  • The second pre-release patch for Minecraft's upcoming 1.21 update focuses on bug fixes and minor changes to improve gameplay and prepare for a smooth launch.
  • The addition of Trial Chambers, Vaults, and powerful new weapons like the mace will offer players a fresh gameplay experience in Minecraft.

Mojang has released a small pre-release patch for Minecraft ahead of the game's 1.21 update. The Tricky Trials update for Minecraft is set to launch in mid-June and promises to bring a slew of exciting new content with it.

Minecraft has long stood as a shining beacon in the gaming community, being the best-selling video game of all time and maintaining a massive player base 15 years after release. Frequent content updates that have kept the game refreshing and fun for longtime fans of the game is a large part of this success, and Mojang intends to keep this going with Tricky Trials, the upcoming 1.21 update for the game. Minecraft revealed the name of the 1.21 Update in April this year, and since then, gamers have been given teasers of what is to come, such as new locations, enemies, and weapons.

Minecraft 's second pre-release patch for update 1.21 is out now. The pre-release consisted of a few minor changes, like making End Crystals immune to fire damage and changing the rarity of certain items. What the second pre-release mostly consists of is bug fixes, all of which were reported by players during the pre-release test. The patching of these bugs aims to make for a smoother launch of Tricky Trials when the update drops for Minecraft on June 13.

The Tricky Trials update looks to be a big one for Minecraft , and many fans are already having fun navigating the pre-release and exploring what's in store. The introduction of Trial Chambers and Vaults offers a new location for veterans to explore and grants a reward to those willing to overcome its challenges. The reward for these chambers, and a major talking point among fans of the game, is the ever-powerful mace, a weapon that completely turns the combat of Minecraft on its head. The mace is the first new proper weapon added to the game since the Trident in 2018 and introduces a slew of unique and devastating mechanics that have the capability of completely changing how combat in Minecraft plays out.

It's not just the player becoming powerful, as two new mobs are also being introduced that will test the mettle of anybody adventuring in the wilderness, and they look to be a satisfying addition to Minecraft 's impressive roster of hostile mobs. The Breeze and the Bogged will both primarily populate the upcoming trial chambers, with Bogged also having a chance to spawn in Swamp biomes. Breezes fire ranged attacks from the air that can easily dislocate the player, while the Bogged have a chance to inflict poison with their arrows, forcing gamers to carefully evaluate how they will approach these chambers if they wish to succeed.

Minecraft is a game that has stood the test of time for so long thanks to its ability to cater to any play style. Whether living a simple life tending a farm, hunting down monsters in underground temples, or using Minecraft to recreate scenes from your favorite movie, there's always going to be something in this game for everyone.

Minecraft 1.21 Pre-Release 2 Patch Notes

Changes

  • End Crystals are now immune to fire damage
  • Added an attestation checkbox when submitting a player report
  • Heavy Core, Trident and Mace are now considered of Epic rarity, giving their hover text a purple color

Technical Changes

  • Data Pack version is now 47

Data Pack Version 47

  • Added new placement modifier type fixed_placement to place features in a set of fixed positions
  • Added new feature type end_platform for the obsidian platform in the end

Bug Fixes

  • The Snout Banner Pattern is treated as common in the game.
  • "Field Masoned", "Skull Charge", "Flow", and "Guster" banner patterns are not mirrored on the backside
  • Flow banner pattern is treated as common loot
  • Guster banner pattern is treated as common loot
  • Infested or Oozing effect cloud shrinks when silverfish or slime enters it
  • Advancement 'Local Brewery' not granted on shift-clicking
  • Copper doors can be used as furnace fuel
  • Your FOV doesn't change back to normal after jumping off from soul sand/soul soil while wearing soul speed boots
  • Your FOV doesn't immediately change when jumping onto soul sand/soul soil while having the slow falling effect and wearing soul speed boots
  • 'in_bounding_box' vertical position for 'spawn_particles' effect is anchored incorrectly
  • Error when traveling through nether portal outside world border
  • The gamerule spawnRadius doesn't work anymore on respawn (always respawn at the same place)
  • block.portal.travel sound no longer plays when entering End portal
  • End crystals now receive fire damage causing them to explode instantly
  • Naturally generated End Stone drops in cases where the Obsidian platform generates inside the island
  • Ender pearls don't work correctly when riding entities and cause players to be teleported for a split second
  • Players cannot traverse dimensions when throwing ender pearls into portals while riding entities
  • The ender dragon death animation is rendered behind blocks when using "Fabulous!" graphic settings
  • Server crashes upon updating from 24w21b to 1.21 Pre-release 1.
  • Each time you pass through an end gateway with an ender pearl from the main island, a new portal is created
  • Crash when bow or crossbow enchanted with multishot runs out of durability
  • Wind Charges can trigger Wind Burst
  • Breaking a Carrot/Warped Fungus on a Stick no longer gives a Fishing Rod
  • Throwing an ender pearl into the end fountain skips the credits
  • Game crashes when saving after teleporting a leashed entity to another dimension
  • Leads attached to a boat are deleted when breaking the boat
  • trial_spawner_bottom texture is different from Bedrock
  • Can respawn mid-air with default spawnpoint
